page.title: 11Dairy Farming 2.
page.content: In{Sept.}the cows begin to calve.All heiffer calves from Canadian Holstein Bulls are kept while any others are sold at aweek old.They are fed first on milk powder, weaned at 5weeks and put out to grass in the Spring.A 5th. cut of silage is taken and any grass seed planted.In{Oct.}-calving in the field if dry otherwise indoors;maize is cut;slurry spread and ploughed into maize field by a Contractor. In{Nov. calving and muck spreading.In{Dec.}the cows are put in calf using semen from selected Canadian Holsteins.In {Jan.Feb.March}Mr Ball continues to milk the cows and carry out general maintenance on the farm.In{April } fertilizer is put on the grass and ground prepared for the maize,planted in the last week.In{May, June,July}and {Aug.}respectively the 1st.2nd.3rd. and 4th.cuts of silage are taken.
